title: Rito with the huge troll
body:
Dev blog mentions concerns about growing mobility creep.

Releases Camille, Rakan, Re-work Galio.

On the other hand, Camille is **countering** mobility.
Her ultimate is the ultimate counter for escapes.
Ekko ult, Talon E, all that stuff doesn't matter. They can not leave.

And to be able to use that skill against them, she needs some form of mobility herself. Otherwise she would never get in range to use it against them.

On top, her mobility has conditions. She has to attach to a wall and that gives her mobility some counterplay in lane. You see which wall she is going to attach to and you can dodge it.
Except the counter to Camille's anti-mobility is...mobility. You need it to prevent a hyper-mobile champion from getting in range of you to use it.

Having a mobile champ with the ability to stop the mobility of the opponent isn't a good combination.

I could understand an immobile champ doing that to counter getting jumped on (cass) or to put them on even ground with hypermobile champs (ryze. annie).

Mobile champs do not also need a counter to mobility.

I would say she has it because she's a diver

How are we supposed to counter Camille's mobility then?
We need a new champion that is even more mobile than her.
Also happens to be a great counter for any immobile champions due to the massive E range.
Th problem is that any counter to mobility is an even bigger counter to immobility. We need more grounded effects in league.

I disagree.

First of all from what you say about grounded effects I'm guessing you see them as an exception to your rule, so I'm going to ignore those.
Thing is that champions like annie(reliability as a counter to mobility), lulu, janna/etc actually are a much bigger pain to mobile champions than immobile ones, as these generally outrange their reliable cc(the trade off for pointclick skills is almost always range, and immobile champions tend to be ranged, or being bulky so a period of point click cc isn't as devastating), I do agree that slows are more effective against immobile champions, but I'd say slows are a counter to immobility, whereas knockups, knock downs, grounding, and pointclick immobilization are a counter to mobility.
I've asked for Xerath W to have that since eons.

They're trying to use mobility more smartly in kits. In Camille's case, they gave her an interesting mobility tool. They also gave her the kitchen sink, which was/is the problem. Rakan is our first super-mobile support, which is neat. Galio got specials mechanics on his movement (pullback and inability to cross walls with E, ally-only targeting with Ult) to keep it from being too ridiculous.

They are working to manage mobility creep, but they're not doing it by refusing to touch it as a mechanic. That would 100% reduce mobility creep, but mobility is annoying for reasons beyond it being so plentiful, and it's important they address those, too.

Sssssssh.

Lee Sin's tri-dash and Renektons 1/2 free dashes are the exact same as Camille's single long-range initiation. /s

Yeah man. Renektons double dash is FREE. The champion could exist without it.

Also it's like Camille doesn't have a huge slow and ulti which makes it so she can stick onto her target (not counting stun because renekton has that too). 

Comparing champions the way you just did is the stupid af

You're misinterpreting what a 'free dash' is.

A free dash is an any-direction dash with zero hindrances or boxes to check. Lucian has a free dash because he can throw it in any direction. Reneketon has a free dash for the same reason. Ezreal has a free blink. etc. Mobility without and real drawback other than "The skill goes on CD".

Conversely, Aurelion Sol might be able to "dash" across half the map but he's visible, has to build up a charge and any damage removes from him. Camille has to leap from a wall and if she's not aiming at a champion, the range is pretty damn short by comparison. Rakan is the last champ with a truly "free" dash (His W) but even then he has a pretty heafty delay due to the knock up.

Renekton has to hit something with his first dash in order to get a second one. So it's not FREE free, but yeah, he can do a lot with it.

If i'm going to be supporting my teammates as a squishy champ, i better not be so easily caught. Rakan's own personality is like that. He wants to be in a thick of a fight and getting out is a breeze for him. That's why he's fun.

Galio is anti-mobility. Camille is mobility WITH anti-mobility. Anti-mobility is inherently weaker vs immobile champs who are meant to hold their ground vs locking in a Yasuo who is meant to be dash happy.

In essence, they didn't remove mobility creep but rather are releasing counters to mobility creep perpetrators.
How is Galio anti-mobility? Every ability he has is avoidable with mobility.

Obviously within his area of influence similar to how Poppy is anti-mobility within hers (W). W sets people up for E and R sets people up for W. For counter-engagement purposes obviously since he's a Warden.

Poppy's w cancels dashes, against mobility Galio's W is just zoning unless someone dashes in just to be taunted. I've played the new Galio a lot and I just feel countered by mobility, similar to Sion and Cho but not as bad. I suppose Galio prevents melee assassins from killing by standing on a squishy but I dont think he counters mobile ranged champs at all.
